name: Mercure Hai Phong
address: 12 Lach Tray Street Ngo Quyen District, 180000 Thành phố Hải Phòng, Việt Nam
description:
Nằm tại thành phố Hải Phòng, Mercure Hai Phong là khách sạn 5 sao có nhà hàng, hồ bơi ngoài trời, trung tâm thể dục, quán bar, Wi-Fi miễn phí, CLB trẻ em và dịch vụ tiền sảnh. Khách sạn còn cung cấp lễ tân 24 giờ, dịch vụ phòng và dịch vụ thu đổi ngoại tệ cho khách.

Mỗi phòng tại khách sạn được trang bị bàn làm việc, TV màn hình phẳng, phòng tắm riêng, máy điều hòa và tủ quần áo.

Mercure Hai Phong phục vụ bữa sáng kiểu lục địa và tự chọn hàng ngày. Nhà hàng phục vụ các món ăn phương Tây, Hàn Quốc và châu Á ngon miệng theo kiểu BBQ và tự chọn. Du khách có thể thưởng thức nhiều loại đồ uống tại quầy bar.

Mercure Hai Phong có sân hiên và tầm nhìn ra quang cảnh thành phố. Khách sạn cũng bố trí spa, trung tâm thể dục và hồ bơi trên tầng mái. Khách doanh nhân có thể sử dụng 6 phòng họp thuận tiện tại đây.

Mercure Hai Phong cách Nhà hát Lớn Hải Phòng 1,8 km, trung tâm thương mại Vincom Plaza Ngô Quyền 2,3 km và sân bay gần nhất là sân bay quốc tế Cát Bi 7 km. Khách sạn cung cấp dịch vụ đưa/đón sân bay kèm phụ phí.

review.comment_negative: The rooms are too small for the beds, with the gap between the cupboards and the beds being around 30cm or less. I have thin skin, and in trying to navigate between wall and cupboard, I lost a heap of skin by engaging an edge, releasing a strong blood flow! Also my side of the bed had no side table or lamp, always a disappointment. The closure of bars is also disappointing, but may be unavoidable? Overall, a plus I guess, notwithstanding these issues. The separation of reception between Floors 1 and 6 is odd, but I guess not really an issue

review.comment_positive: The young staff were uniformly pleasant, and were a credit to staff training. The unsatisfactory fridge was replaced promptly. The breakfast offering was reasonable to perhaps better than that, but was overpriced at c.AUD 20 a head. Location was good with our relatives just down the road.
review.comment_negative: This review was impossible to fill out in detail and looks as though it has been tampered with to make it impossible. If so, that is a real discredit to the property. The toilet room is incredibly small and grossly inconvenient, even for two fit and BMI-conforming people. There are not enough hooks/hangers, and the property has been built so that guests are almost compelled to use the laundry service. My wife and I travel the world for 4-5 months a year, and have visited 70 countries. The reason we do our own washing has nothing to do with cost: it has been the trouble we have had over the years. There is really nowhere to hang washing here. Using the lighting system is a nightmare when you read at night as we do. The bench space for toiletries is small, too small really. This is a property where. OST of construction has been placed ahead of customer service. If it were not for the pleasant staff, the overall rating would have been 5/6

review.rating: Stylish and modern but lacks good air conditioning (among other things)
review.room_type: Căn hộ Studio có 2 Giường Đơn
review.comment_positive:
When interacting with staff, they were generally helpful.
I felt the service from staff at the entrance was best. They always smiled, waved and greeted you as you go in and out of the hotel.
Rooms were stylish and modern.
It seems that there are plenty of parking spots if needed.
The view from the pool is great.
Generally it is a good hotel.
review.comment_negative:
Unfortunately I did not feel that the experience reflected that of a 5 star.
Air conditioning (which is most important to me, particularly during the hot 40-degree Summer season) was weak. When raising the issue I was told that this is due to the way the air conditioning system worked. I asked if it were possible to move rooms but I was told that this isn't possible without paying a considerable amount for an upgrade. 
The hotel is hidden behind a Highlands Coffee, meaning it is very easy to go past it. It is poorly signposted.
Pool is unfortunately dirty; the water murky and full of debris. I went once and not again.
The light switches in the room were difficult to operate - they are plain buttons with no marks.
There is no granular control of the lights. For example, you could not have just one single light on (ideally used as a nightlight), you had to have all the lights in the room on for it to be on. 
Showers took too long to turn hot (around 2-3 minutes from cold to the chosen temperature setting!). For me also I felt the water pressure was not good.
